Questions.Label: Upload your organisation's safeguarding policy
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
This must include how your organisation will:

  • promote the policy
  • get commitment towards the policy
  • train its employees in implementing the policy
  • protect its apprentices
  • prevent abuse towards its apprentices
  • have way of raising, recording and investigating concerns
  • have a way of apprentices getting support or guidance
  • monitor its IT usage
  • review this policy annually

Your safeguarding policy must include your last review date.

Find out more about safeguarding in the Care Act 2014 (opens in a new windows or tab).

The file must be a PDF and smaller than 5MB.

Pages.LinkTitle: Does your organisation's safeguarding policy include its responsibilities towards the Prevent duty?

Details.Title: What is the Prevent duty statement?
Details.Body: The Prevent duty statement is 'to have due regard to the need to prevent people from being drawn into terrorism'.

Questions.Label: Does your organisation's safeguarding policy include its responsibilities towards the Prevent duty?
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
This means your organisation's safeguarding policy includes how it will:

  • have a legal responsibility to fulfil the Prevent duty statement
  • protect apprentices and employees from radicalising influences
  • ensure apprentices and employees are resilient to extreme narratives
  • identify changes in behaviour of apprentices and employees
  • deal with any issues raised by apprentices or employees

Find out about the Prevent duty (opens in a new windows or tab)

Details.Title: What is the Prevent duty statement?
Details.Body: The Prevent duty statement is 'to have due regard to the need to prevent people from being drawn into terrorism'.

Questions.Label: Upload your organisation's Prevent duty policy
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
This can be your Prevent risk assessment and action plan.

This must include how your organisation will:

  • promote the policy
  • get commitment to the policy
  • train employees in implementing the policy
  • have a legal responsibility to fulfil the Prevent duty statement
  • protect apprentices and employees from radicalising influences
  • ensure apprentices and employees are resilient to extreme narratives
  • identify changes in behaviour of apprentices and employees
  • deal with any issues raised by apprentices or employees
  • review this policy annually

Your Prevent duty policy must include your last review date.

Find out more about the Prevent duty (opens in a new windows or tab).

The file must be a PDF and smaller than 5MB.
